answers.answer: I would go just to be safe
Awesome that I'm lying here in agony and the what's for dinner post gets more replys. This forum is useless.

That happened to me once the doc told me to take a tylenol so i did but i waited until my head was pounding to take it so it took a while to work but try tylenol and pit a warm rag oved ur eyes if that dont help i would go to the doc....
I know :( every time I need help no one answers me either. You should go to l&d to be safe. Hopefully it is a migraine but then again a migraine woildnt cause abdominal pain.
Preeclampsia is usually associated with high blood pressure and swelling. It could also cause headaches but before anything I'd check your blood pressure first just to rule it out
I'm 26 weeks and I have noway to check my blood presure.

I think its just a migraine i had them alot it worried me to....my sis thought i may have preclammsia so thats what led me to call my doc....they told me to take tylenol and u can even take advil up to 28 weeks
Call labor and delivery see whay they recommend.
To be on the safe side go to the er or l&d. It's better to be safe preeclampisa isn't anything to play with.

I had preeclampsia with my daughter and the only reason j officially knew i had it was when i was in labor my body was pretty much refusing the medicine they gave me and i would throw up idk if at 26 weeks theres any way to confirm preeclampsia typically the doctors wait to xloser to.ur due date and run blood pressure tests and have u eat a more plain, bland type of diet. Good.luck

question: I went to bed with abdominal pain.. woke up with a massive pounding headache. Vomited.and now I'm in so much pain I can't sleep. Could it be preeclampsia? Should I go to hospital?
title: preeclampsia??
